UPOsHam

Theory

  • Unstable Periodic Orbits in Hamiltonian systems

Methods:

  • Differential correction
  • Turning point
  • Turning point based on configuration difference

Examples:

  • De Leon-Berne Hamiltonian
  • Coupled and uncouple quartic Hamiltonian

Contributing and reporting:

  • Contributing to UPOsHam
  • Code of Conduct
  • What should I know before I get started?
  • How Can I Contribute?
    • Reporting Bugs

Contributing to UPOsHam¶

Thank you for considering and taking the time to contribute!

The following is a set of guidelines (borrowed from the Atom project by Github) for contributing to this package. As always use your best judgment and feel free to propose changes to this document in a pull request.

Code of Conduct

What should I know before I get started?

How Can I Contribute?

  • Reporting Bugs

  • Suggesting Enhancements

  • Pull Requests

Additional Notes

  • Issue and Pull Request Labels

Code of Conduct¶

This project and everyone participating in it is governed by the Contributor Covenant. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code. Please report unacceptable behavior to wl16298@bristol.ac.uk and or shiba@vt.edu.

What should I know before I get started?¶

We recommend familiarity with unstable periodic orbits and their role in Hamiltonian dynamics. Good starting point on these topics are provided in the README for this repository.

How Can I Contribute?¶

Reporting Bugs¶

As per open-source modus operandi, open an issue in Github using the standard style listed here. Alternatively, you can send bug reports with a short description and the script to reproduce the error to the authors: wl16298@bristol.ac.uk and or shiba@vt.edu.
